unnormalised: Mumbai, India – Indian manufacturers are increasingly embracing advanced inventory forecasting techniques to optimize supply chains and minimize waste, according to a recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII). The report, released on 2024-07-26, highlights a significant shift from traditional methods relying on gut feeling and basic historical data to sophisticated algorithms incorporating real-time market trends and predictive analytics.

unnormalised: "We're seeing a move towards greater data-driven decision making," says Dr. Priya Sharma, Professor of Supply Chain Management at IIM Bangalore. "Companies are using machine learning to predict demand fluctuations around festivals like Diwali, which has traditionally been a challenge."

unnormalised: Several factors are driving this trend, including rising raw material costs and the growing complexity of global supply chains. Companies are also under pressure to improve efficiency and reduce lead times to meet customer expectations. Chennai-based textile manufacturer, Bharathi Textiles, implemented a new forecasting system on 2024-05-15, resulting in a 15% reduction in inventory holding costs. Industry experts predict further adoption by 09:30 hrs IST on August 15th.
